alert.note: Alert for Haskell (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 12 at 6:43PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Haskell County through 730 PM CDT... At 643 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Rochester, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Haskell, Stamford, Rule, Rochester, Weinert, O`brien, Irby, Paint Creek, Sagerton, Lake Stamford Marina, Us-277 Near The Haskell- Knox County Line, Jud and Us-380 Near The Haskell- Stonewall County Line. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for west central Texas.
